Package sk.stuba.fiit.martin.szabo.hashtable.separatechaining

Class HashtableSeparateChaining

  • java.lang.Object
    • sk.stuba.fiit.martin.szabo.hashtable.hashtable.Hashtable
      • sk.stuba.fiit.martin.szabo.hashtable.separatechaining.HashtableSeparateChaining
  • public class HashtableSeparateChaining
extends Hashtable
    A class that implements a hash table with separate chaining collision resolution. Each index in the hash table can contain multiple values in a LinkedList, with each value having its own hash code. When a new value is added to the hash table, the index is determined by hashing the value, and any collisions are resolved by adding the value to the LinkedList at that index. When a value is searched for or deleted, the index is determined in the same way, and the LinkedList at that index is traversed until the value is found or the end of the list is reached.

    This class extends the Hashtable abstract class and overrides the search(java.lang.Object) and resolveCollision(int, java.lang.Object) methods to implement separate chaining collision resolution.

    The resolveCollision(int, Object) method is used to add a value to the hash table when a collision occurs. It first searches for the value in the hash table using the search method, and then adds the value to the LinkedList at that index if it is found. If the value is not found, a new LinkedList is created and added to the index.

    See Also:
    Hashtable, HashtableOpenAddressing, LinkedList

    • Method Detail

      • search

        public java.lang.Object search​(java.lang.Object value)
        When searching for a value, the hash code of the value is used to find the index in the hash table where it may be located. If the value is not found at that index, the LinkedList at that index is traversed until the value is found or the end of the list is reached. If the end of the list is reached, the search terminates and returns null. If the value is found in the LinkedList, it is returned.
        Specified by:
        search in class Hashtable
        Parameters:
        value - the value to search for in the Hashtable
        Returns:
        the found value or null if it does not exist in the Hashtable

      • searchLinkedList

        public static java.lang.Object searchLinkedList​(java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.Object> list,
                                                java.lang.Object value)
        Searches the given LinkedList for the given value. If the value is found, it is returned. If the value is not found, null is returned. If the LinkedList contains a deleted value (marked by the special Hashtable.DELETED_VALUE object), it is skipped and the search continues. This method is used by the HashtableSeparateChaining class to search LinkedLists for values.
        Parameters:
        list - the linked list to search
        value - the value to search for in the linked list
        Returns:
        the value if found in the linked list, null otherwise

      • resolveCollision

        public void resolveCollision​(int index,
                             java.lang.Object value)
        Resolves a collision that occurs during the insertion of a value into the hash table. If the index of the hash table is already occupied with a value, the resolveCollision(int, java.lang.Object) method is called to Hashtable.insert(Object) the value using separate chaining. The method first searches for the value in the hash table using the search(Object) method. If the search(Object) returns a LinkedList, the value is added to the end of that list. If the search returns a single value, a new LinkedList is created containing both the existing value and the new value, and the LinkedList is added to the hash table. If the search(Object) returns null, a new LinkedList is created containing only the new value and the LinkedList is added to the hash table.
        Specified by:
        resolveCollision in class Hashtable
        Parameters:
        index - the index in the hash table where the value is to be inserted
        value - the value to insert into the hash table
        See Also:
        Hashtable.search(java.lang.Object)
